For many years now she has earned a living by selling fish. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to  to buy new fishing nets. Emerma has been a member of GDMPC for two years, and her goal is to buy a new fishing boat in about two years.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past 8 years she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi, 23 years old, lives alone in Kutaisi district, West Georgia. Several times, he requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Givi’s mother is working abroad. She is sending transfers to Givi. Also, he is renting out rooms in his house to get a small monthly income.

Givi requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Givi will purchase a car. He will start driving it as a taxi and will serve local people, to earn additional daily income. Givi is a very hard-working man. He wants to start his own business and increase the family income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve his living conditions and provide a better future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase a car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  47 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  GNIRE 2ème personne à droite de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 210 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon C Group are married women with an average age of 47 years and and average of three children. They are all living in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh agricultural loan with the institution, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Gnire (shown in the photo second from the right, in the front row), grows crops of peanuts, rice, corn and peppers, among other things. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Gnire expects to earn an average income of 210,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow Gnire to repay her loan and to help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 49-year-old married mother. She has 11 children, six of whom are still living under her roof. She owns her own small bakery where she prepares Lebanese bread for the whole village. Her husband is a retired army officer, but his retirement salary is not enough to provide for his entire family. 

They have two children in a private school and two other children in a public school, which means they also have schooling expenses to settle on top of all the other expenses. Sending her children to school is very important for Sanaa because she wants them to have the opportunities that she unfortunately could not get, since the highest education she ever got was an elementary school degree. Thus, improving her socioeconomic situation would help her keep her children in school without it being a heavy burden on the family's shoulders. 

This is why she decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan. In fact, she needs to buy a new slicer machine that would facilitate the work in her bakery. She also needs to install a new balustrade in her house. In the future, Sanaa wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new slicer machine that would facilitate the work in her bakery. She also needs to install a new balustrade in her house.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto. His previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy the needed spare parts and to get maintenance done on his jeepney. He has been in this business for eighteen years now. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to get maintenance done on their Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Alberto dreams of expanding his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Al-Sada Group

texts.en: The Al-Sada group consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB. Suad is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is very hardworking and is doing his best to earn money. She intends to renovate her house. She decided to help her husband and applied for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that their life conditions will improve and that they will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house.

loans.name: Shingirirai Club Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! Francisca is 38 years old and lives in Harare. She is married and the mother of one child, who attends a local school. She does not have any other dependents to look after, and has earned a living for the last six years by selling electrical items. The main challenges she faces are high import duties and stiff competition from other sellers. Francisca has requested a loan for $750 to buy a new stock of electrical items to sell to her customers. She says the extra income generated by this loan will improve her standard of living and allow her to send her child to a better school. In the future, Francisca plans to build her own store.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 24 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district with her aunt and uncle. Teona requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Teona works at the local shop as a salesperson. Her aunt works in the restaurant as a waitress. They both earn small monthly salaries, which is the only source of living for the family. 

Teona is requesting a loan from Credo to start a family business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her loan,Teona will open an entertaining center. She will rent a room, renovate it as needed, and hire people who will be working as animators on private orders on call. There is not many of this kind of centers in Kutaisi district and Teona hopes this will help her to have a good numbers of clients. She will try to have all kinds of entertainments needed for birthdays or other celebrations to satisfy clients' needs and make her business successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and Teona will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open an entertaining center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of products for sale (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, soaps,...).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread and ice cream of different flavors and varieties, such as popsicles and cones, among others.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This is the second loan for this borrower. Nasiba is an honest person and has a good credit story. She has run an animal husbandry business since 2003. There are 6 people in her family. She lives with her husband and her 4 children, both boys and girls. Her husband is a driver in Russia. 

Since last year Nasiba has been rebuilding her house, and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. Her son is going to be married and she must finish all the building work before autumn. 

The 10,000 somoni loan that Nasiba is taking will be dedicated to buying some missing construction  materials for rebuilding her family house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has seven children. She has been frying fish and selling to the locals for nine months now. She knew about Milango through a friend, and now she seeks a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy fish and 20 liters of cooking oil to allow her to reach more customers. She has employed one person who helps her run the business. She will be supplying fish to other places in five years. The major challenge she faces is bad debts. The means of transportation are also another challenge.

loans.use: to buy fish and 20 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Bachuki

texts.en:
Bachuki is 32 years old. He lives in Lagodekhi District with his 27-year-old wife and two-year-old daughter. Several times, Bachuki requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Bachuki is working as an operator at the local petrol station, on a small, monthly salary. This is the only income for them and it’s rarely enough to feed the family.

Bachuki requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Bachuki has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Bachuki will rent a vineyard. The vineyard that he wants to rent already has grapes growing, so he will not have any extra expenses. Bachuki will harvest grapes and sell them at the local markets, at a good price. He hopes this will increase his monthly income and he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to rent a vineyard.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  D Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON D sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  MARIAM au beau milieu de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon D Group are all married women with an average age of 39 years and an average of three children. They are all living in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

The are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh agricultural loan with the institution, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Mariam (shown in the photo in the center of the front row), grows crops of peanuts, rice, corn and peppers among other things. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Mariam hopes to earn an average income of 200,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Félix  tiene un negocio de venta de fruta y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con el objetivo de trabajar lo propio y generar sus propios ingresos.  Su negocio esta establecido en un pequeño lugar  en el centro del mercado donde exhibe los productos para que los clientes lleguen a comprar, vende de toda clase de verdura y fruta  fresca como tomate, chile, repollo, cebolla, rábano, yuca, jilotes, papas, limones, naranja, bananos, mangos, etc.  Manifiesta que las ventas son a diario ya que son productos que las amas de casa necesitan en el hogar.
Don Félix esta solicitando un cuarto préstamo por 6,000 lempiras, para comprar verduras y frutas frescas para la venta.  Como tomate, repollo, papas, yuca, Chile, banano, naranja, mangos, etc. Esta inversión piensa incrementar las ventas y la atención a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para tener más volumen en las ventas y poder  tener un local acondicionado y fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
57-year old Félix lives with his common-law wife and four children in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He has a business selling fruit and vegetables which he started three years ago as he wanted an income-generating business of his own. It is located in a small space in the centre of the market where customers can come see the produce. 

Félix sells many types of fresh fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, chilli peppers, cabbage, onions, radishes, yucca, young maize, potatoes, lemons, oranges, bananas, and mangoes. His stall is open every day as his customers need these products on a daily basis. He is now seeking his fourth loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy fresh fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, yucca, chilli peppers, bananas, oranges, and mangoes. He believes that the loan will help him increase sales and provide better service.

His goals are to continue growing his business, make more sales, and have permanent premises in good repair.

loans.use: Buy a wide variety of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a member of a six-person group. She is a 42-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. She and her husband have owned a fast food business for 5 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Now, for the further growth of their business, Naseem as a member of a six-person borrower group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. 

Their family expenditures are much higher compared to the monthly income and savings. Therefore Naseem wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profits. As a result they can increase their monthly income as well as their savings. She hopes for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such great help and kindness. 

In the picture, Naseem is raising her hand.

loans.use: To expand the restaurant business.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 49-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is successful with his farm, planting, harvesting and selling mango and products from other fruit trees. 

He became a member of GDMPC micro credit in 2011 and has now borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP, with which, in addition to his capital, he will buy a farm adjacent to his farm. He plans to use the new farm as an expansion of his current farming business.

loans.use: to buy a farm.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, as well as pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, and for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melanie hopes to have another tricycle and dreams to give her children a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for tricycle

loans.name: Dayae

texts.en: Dayae, age 46, is from Iraq. He is married and the father of four children. Dayae is the sole provider for his family. Dayae owns a small shop where sells mobile phones, recharge cards and mobile accessories such as headsets and mobile covers. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Dayae earned a good reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices and free maintenance services for his clients. Dayae is applying for a loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent on his shop. Dayae believes that this loan will give him a chance to expand his business and increase his profits and will give him the ability to take better care of his family and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 46-year-old hard-working housewife. She loves in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a janitor by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to cover the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past six years, he has also been driving a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open an auto mechanic shop in the future. Naseem desires to provide a quality education to her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to meet the cost of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en: Nerie's main source of income comes from her gardening business. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is from Bayabas, Aurora, and has been in gardening for three years, earning PHP 3,000 a month. Aside from this, she also raises piglets for sale. She recently applied for a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en: 55-year-old Vakhtang lives in a small village, Nunisi, in Kharagauli district, with his wife Makvala. Vakhtang applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family owns a small agricultural plot, where nut trees are grown. They also have a booth, which is rented out for 100 GEL. Vakhtang has a car, and he drives it as a taxi to transport local people, to earn a small additional daily income. Vakhtang applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vakhtang has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With his credit, Vakhtang will buy a milk cow. His wife will look after the cow and milk it every day to produce dairy products. The products will be sold at the market and among the villagers. Vakhtang hopes this will help him to earn more income for the family. He wants to try to expand his agriculture business in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Haind

texts.en: Haind is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is a kind woman who offers great opportunities to students. She is a teacher who is paid a low salary. She is not as interested in getting money, as she is in focusing on educating students. She thinks this career serves society. She lives with her family in a bad situation, and she intends to buy construction supplies to use for her small house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. She hopes to improve her living standards with this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use to improve her a small house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena  tiene 41 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 9 años que se encuentra en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Chasquipampa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is 41 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 9 who attend school. She sells basic food items from her corner store located in the Chasquipampa area. This is her first loan with the institution and she plans to use it to buy merchandise such as groceries, candy, and soft drinks to sell in the store. These items are much in demand and more sales will be generated. The challenge Elena faces is competition from the several stores in the area.

She will use the profits to buy more merchandise as stock for the store and continue expanding. Her wish is to see a thriving business and a well-stocked store so that her income will increase and she can provide a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buy stock for her corner store

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo y por la facilidad que la Institución brinda; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas para el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos y con ello logro apoyar a su familia; las  condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Julio needs to obtain a new loan because he requires more working capital. Our institution offers him easy payment terms. This loan will allow him to purchase fertilizer, weed killers, insecticides, and pesticides for his crops.

The previous loan helped him improve his income, which allowed him to support his family. His financial situation and family circumstances have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killers, insecticides, and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal is a from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Hilal works to provide an income for his family all by himself, while his wife takes care of their children.

Hilal is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. He provides his neighborhood with basic family staples such as canned food, dairy products, snacks, and detergents. He has been in this field since 2005 and gained his experience through hard work. Hilal has a hired employee and is well known for his knowledge of the market.

Hilal is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a refrigerator, to install aluminum shelves, and to increase his inventory. Hilal aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to educate his children and provide them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, install aluminum shelves and increase inventory

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 55 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his wife, Lali, his 20-year-old son, and his retired mother. 

Several times, Eldar requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Eldar is trading with fruits and vegetables. He has a counter at the local market, where the products are sold. His wife is working at the local food factory, as a cook. The family's additional income comes from Eldar’s mother’s monthly pension. 

Eldar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Eldar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Eldar will rent another counter at the local market and purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables. He will expand his business and significantly increase the family income. 

Eldar is a very hard-working man. He will work hard and long hours to make his business more successful. Eldar will be reinvesting part of the profit in the same field in order to purchase more varieties of products and to better satisfy his clients' needs. Another part of the profit will be used to ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to rent another counter at the local market and purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. It also helped in her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

Salvacion would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs of her arcade and billiard set. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion hopes that her business is successful and dreams to have good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and to maintain her arcade and billiard set.

loans.name: Al Samraa Group

texts.en:
Fatima, Mona, Nohad, and Najah are four women who live in the same neighborhood and have been friends for a long time. Each of them has a financial need, which is why they decided to join hands and contact Al Majmoua to acquire a group loan.

Fatima. the leader and featured member of Al Samraa group, is a 34-year-old married mother of two children; she is shown on the far right in the picture. Fatima owns a small business that sells facial creams, while her husband works in a small communication engineering shop (mobile phone maintenance and shop, etc.). They both earn barely enough to cover their own expenses, which is a great obstacle in their desire to provide a good education for their children. In fact, their very low incomes forced their children to drop out of school. Fatima and her husband are waiting for their economic situation to improve in order to enroll their children in school again. She decided to request the loan because she needs to purchase merchandise for her business in order to expand the range of products she offers.

Mona, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, is shown on the far left in the picture. She owns a hairdressing salon, while her husband is a taxi driver. Both her children are enrolled in a private school although they can barely pay for their tuition fees and their monthly expenses. Mona decided to join the Al Samraa group because her sister's wedding is coming up, and she has no means of buying a dress for that cherished event.

Seated second from the right in the picture is Nohad, a 40-year-old married mother of three children. Nohad owns a small business that sells Lebanese pastry, while her husband has his own winch. Their low income status does not allow them to lead a healthy life with their children. Nohad wishes to purchase an oven, and a mobile phone for her daughter, which is why she decided to request the loan.

Najah, a 32-year-old married mother of four children and seated second to the left in the picture, works in a small computer shop where her husband is also an employee. Their combined revenue does not cover their monthly expenses, and her children are not currently enrolled in school, awaiting an improvement of their parents' financial situation to improve before they go back. Najah needs the loan in order to start selling beauty creams and cosmetics for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business in order to expand the range of products she offers.

loans.name: Damarys De Los Angeles

texts.es: Damarys es una cliente exitosa con 41 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos adolescente, tiene 6 años que su negocio es la venta de ropa a vecinos, pobladores de la comunidad, tiene de ser cliente 6 años lleva varios ciclos de préstamo que a pagado muy bien. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisetas, blusas, chores, ropa interior de varón y ropa interior de dama.
texts.en: Damary's is a successful client who is 41 years old, married with two teen children, and has spent six years in her business of selling clothing to neighbors and community inhabitants.  She has been a client for six years and has had several loan cycles that she has paid off well.  She will use this loan to buy clothing like men's pants, women's pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, men's underwear and women's underwear.

loans.use: to buy clothing like men's pants, women's pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, men's underwear and women's underwear, etc.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: maíz, gas, cal, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Elsy needs a new loan because she needs more capital to continue investing in her business; this will make it possible for her to buy raw materials like corn, gas and lime powder, among others.

The previous loan helped her move forward and improve her income.  Economic conditions and family circumstances have optimized.

loans.use: to by corn, gas and lime powder, among others.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Bendición este conformado por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal. Que luchan día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante, Senelia  tiene por actividad económica, una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, arroz, frijoles, huevos, queso, azúcar, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Mi Bendición agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Mi Bendición” (My Blessing) communal bank has 8 members, seven women and one man.  They are responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children in their care.  They are from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country.   They are noted for being responsible, hardworking and with a strong wish for self-improvement.  They strive daily to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her spirit and drive to get ahead, Senelia’s economic activity is a grocery store.  It’s a small store that sells edible products in small amounts like coffee, rice, beans, eggs, cheese, sugar, juice and soft-drinks.  She spends about 12 hours daily selling her products.

The goal of the loan is to invest in her working capital and to stock her store purchasing groceries to sell so that in the not too distant future she’ll be able to earn higher income.

The Mi Bendición communal bank is grateful for the support Kiva lenders are providing people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo  es un señor de 54 años de edad, quien actualmente tiene 8 hijos los cuales son  2 hombres y 6 mujeres quienes  viven en  el Sector Central, caserío Chuimanzana, Cantón El Tablón, Sololá.
El es agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de  papa, cebolla, maíz y frijol,  a través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva 10 años realizando esta labor junto a sus 2 hijos mayores que lo apoyan en todo el trabajo que requieren estos cultivos.
El necesita un impulso financiero por lo cual está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de papa.
Sueña con darles una mejor educación a sus hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando, para que en un futuro tengan más y mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Bartolo, 54, has 8 children two of which are boys and six are girls; they live in the Central Sector, Chumanzana settlement, El Tablón Canton, Sololá.  

He works in agriculture growing potatoes, onions, corn and beans.  By means of this activity he earns sufficient income to help support his family.  He’s been doing this work for ten years alongside his two oldest sons who help him with all the work the crops require.

He needs a financial push which is why he’s asking for a 2,500 Quetzal loan to buy fertilizer for his potato crop.  He dreams with providing his children who are still in school with a better education so that in future they’ll have more and better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato  crop.

loans.name: Abduqayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм житель севера Таджикистана, города Исфары. Ему 45 лет. В данное время работает в сельском хозяйстве. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Раньше Абдукаюм всегда в сезон работы ехал в Россию на заработки. Теперь он имеет возможность не покидать страну. Он уже год как в своем селе занимается растениеводством. Абдукаюм на 1га орошаемой земли выращивает рис и кукурузу. Сейчас Абдукаюм нуждается в кредите. Ему необходимо приобрести минеральные удобрения для урожая риса и кукурузы и нанять наемных рабочих для обработки земли. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Абдукаюм хочет получить качественный урожай и увеличить семейный доход.
texts.en: Abduqayum lives in northern Tajikistan in a city called Isfara.  He is 45 years old and currently works on a farm.  He is married and has three kids.  Previously, Abduqayum traveled each year to work in Russia.  Now he doesn't need to leave the country.  For a year he has been working his farm.  On his land, one hectare, he grows rice and corn.  Now he needs a loan.  He must buy fertilizers for his harvest and hire laborers to work his land.  This loan will provide high quality crops which will increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice and corn harvests as well as to pay laborers.

loans.name: Aladinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALADINAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por neuve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alison es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de producción por catálogo, trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s, costura de polleras, venta de fruta, venta de salchipapa, venta de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alison es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza; este negocio lo emprendió con el préstamo que saco en Pro Mujer por.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la atención en salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “Aladinas” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board whose secretary is Alison.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which are catalog sales, blanket weaving, neighborhood store, CD sales, skirt sewing, fruit selling, ‘salchipapa’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] sales and coffee sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Alison.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for six months having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling beauty products that she started with a loan she got from Pro Mujer.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy cosmetics from suppliers and then resell them on order.  This way of working allows her to generate income for her schooling.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services and the training.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Patricia Isabel

texts.es: Patricia es emprendedora su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, frijoles cocidos, esta actividad de negocio  tiene cinco años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores que mantener,  este crédito lo invertira en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, blusas de dama, camisas de varón, cremas faciales, crema para las manos, cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para los pies, zapatos deportivos de varón, zapatos de dama, etc.
texts.en: Patricia is an entrepreneur.  Her business is selling clothes, shoes and cooked beans.  She’s been in this business for five years.  She’s married and has two minor children to support.  She will use this loan to buy clothes like men’s pants, women’s pants, women’s blouses, men’s shirts, face cream, hand cream, body cream, foot cream, men’s athletic shoes, women’s shoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, empezó su negocio hace años atrás vendiendo puerta a puerta la mercadería y papelería como juguetes, cuadernos, artículos de hogar etc. Poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio hasta ahora que tiene ya clientes establecidos. 

Trabaja todos los días vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.25, rompecabezas a $ 1.50, juguetes a $ 1.25. El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar. A pesar de su enfermedad ya que el es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida) el quiere seguir adelante trabajando y mejorar su economía (es transexual).  

El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar artículos de bazar, como cuadernos, plumas, ropa, artículos de hogar etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir adelante disfrutar de su familia y quisiera en el futuro tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  Years ago he started his business by selling door to door.  He sells merchandise and stationery products like toys, notebooks, and household items, etc.  Little by little he was increasing his business, and he now has established customers.

He works every day selling notebooks for $1.25, puzzles for $1.50, and toys for $1.25.  He has a lot of aspirations with his business.  Therefore, he wants to continue.  In spite of his illness, he is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS), he wants to get ahead working and improving his finances (he is transexual).

The loan that he is requesting is to buy miscellaneous goods like notebooks, pens, clothes, and household items, etc.  He has a lot of aspirations to get ahead and enjoy his family.  In the future he would like to have a place to sell his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, clothes, and household items.

loans.name: Los Aguacatillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Alejandra de estado civil unida de hecho, tiene 28 años de edad curso 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a comprar y vender frutas en el mercado de la localidad, inició este negocio vendiendo frutas con sus vecinos y ellos la apoyaron; hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de frutas para surtir su negocio, en el futuro desea tener capital grande, también desea comprar un vehículo para poder salir a distribuir su venta por mayor; las demás integranetes del grupo se dedican a vender frutas.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Alejandra, who is in a common-law marriage, is 28 years old. She completed 6 years of primary education. She has two children, and one of them is in school. She buys and sells fruit in the local market. She began this business selling fruit with her neighbors, and they helped her. At this time, she has seven years of experience.

She organized a group and is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase fruit to stock her business. In the future she wants to have greater capital. She also wants to buy a vehicle to be able to distribute her wholesale sales. The other members of the group sell fruit.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruit

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.en:
Jose dreams of becoming a professional. Jose was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias and is concerned about affording tuition fees. He expects to graduate with a business degree in November 2013, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Potosi. Jose plans on using the funds to pay his graduation fee. 

Jose notes that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. He says that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Jose currently works 25 hours a week. With a degree in business he expects to earn $15 a day. Jose's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of 5, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Jose is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without assistance.  Jose's father's salary from his job as a constructor is the family's primary source of income.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Andrea Karin

texts.en:
Andrea has always dreamed of becoming a professional. To achieve her goal, Andrea has enrolled in the Unicen. She expects to graduate in July 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Andrea plans on using the loan funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Andrea shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With two older siblings Andrea is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a loan. Andrea is married with her own child, but this has not stopped her from pursing her dream. With a professional degree and a career in business, she will be able to provide her family with a better life. Andrea currently works 40 hours a week as a admin secretary to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fee

loans.name: Guisela Amanda

texts.en:
Guisela dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Guisela is currently attending the Universidad Pública De El Alto, working towards her degree in business. She plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save money until she can return to school. 

Guisela plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Until now she has managed to get by without books, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

With a degree in business she expects to earn $17 a day. Guisela's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of 3, finances have always been tight. With three older siblings Guisela is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a loan.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for school supplies

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Petrona's dream. Petrona is currently attending the Instituto Tecnico Catec, working towards her degree in business. She expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Petrona plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. With a degree in business she expects to earn $10 a day.

She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Petrona shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Unfortunately, Petrona's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. With two other siblings, Petrona is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a loan. Petrona is married with her own child. With a professional degree and a career in business, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better life.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Jorge Marcelo

texts.en:
Jorge has always dreamt of becoming a professional. Jorge was accepted into the Univalle and now with the chance to achieve his dream is concerned about affording tuition fees. He expects to graduate in November 2013, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Jorge shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a Vittana loan, Jorge plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Jorge hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. With a career in business, he expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before.

With one younger brother and three younger sisters, Jorge hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Paola Judith

texts.en:
Paola dreams of becoming a politician but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Paola is currently attending UDABOL, working towards her degree in international relations. She plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Kiva she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With the loan, Paola plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz.

Paola currently works 30 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Paola earns $10 a day. With a degree in international relations she expects to earn $15 a day. As the youngest of 2, with one older sibling attending college already, Paola is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance a loan. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.en:
Jorge dreams of becoming a civil engineer. To achieve his goal, Jorge has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés. He plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school.

With a Vittana loan, Jorge plans on using his loan to buy his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a career in civil engineering, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for schools supplies

loans.name: Maria Argelia

texts.es:
María Argelia es una joven de 25 años de edad madre de un hijo el cual es menor de edad y vive bajo su mismo techo en compañía de ella y su padre. Ella tiene una educación media cursada hasta el 9 grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en el cultivo de hortalizas como ser: lechuga, brócoli, repoyo, etc. En la actualidad ella está trabajando la tierra para poder cultivar más producto ya que las tierras que cultivan son propias y amplias para poder agregar una línea más en la cual ella ha trabajado anteriormente como lo es el cultivo de papa.

Ella actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla de papa certificada, abonos y fertilizantes para su asistencia y mantenimiento ya que es necesario para su crecimiento y seguridad en el producto.

Sus metas son poder cultivar una buena cantidad de papa para poder generar una excelente ganancia sobre el producto y volver a re-invertir en el mismo pero un poco más libre de compromisos. Sus Sueños como madre es apoyar a su hijo hasta el final cumpliendo con sus estudios, necesidades entre otras que se presenten en el camino.
texts.en:
María Argelia, 25, is the mother of a young son who lives with her and his father at home. She finished 9th grade; however, she could not continue because her parents could not pay for additional schooling. They taught her how to grow vegetables such as lettuce, broccoli, and cabbage. She now farms to be able to produce more, as she owns the land and has bought more to add an additional crop, potatoes. 

She has applied for a loan to buy certified potato seed, manure, and fertilizer to fortify and maintain her crop, as this is necessary for its growth and health. Her goals are to produce a good potato harvest, to generate a good profit from the crop, and to reinvest, but with less commitments. As a mother, she dreams of helping her son finish his education, among other needs that present themselves along the way.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed, manure, and fertilizer to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maricela, quien con su anterior credikiva logró comprar útiles escolares, artículos de miscelánea, con los cuales surtió su negocio. Sus ingresos se enfrentaron, porque impactó la atención, el interés, el deseo y la acción de compra de su clientela. Hoy,  ella y su familia, tienen un mayor bienestar y esto la hace sentir mucho mas satisfecha. En la actualidad Maricela está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará artículos de tocador, productos desechables y variedades en general.  Con ello tendrá una mercancía que rota rápidamente, mientras ella gana cada vez mas y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Maricela who, with her previous loan, was able to buy school materials and miscellaneous items to stock up her business.  Her income increased because the products generated attention and interest from customers who wanted and bought the products.  Now, Maricela and her family are better off and Maricela feels more satisfied.  Maricela is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy disposable crockery and cutlery and other general products.  With the new stock, she will have merchandise that has a high turnover and Maricela will be earning ever more, making her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy disposable crockery and cutlery, miscellaneous items and products for women and for the home.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 29 years old. She lives in the Gori District with her 31-year-old husband, Vasil, and two children (8 and 7 years old). Elza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a small plot of land, where different types of fruits and vegetables are grown. They also have a milk cow. The cow is milked every day to produce dairy products. Elza and her husband are working very hard to earn a small monthly income. They sell dairy products and harvested products at the local markets and among the villagers. 

Elza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Elza will purchase a mini-tractor. Her husband will work on private orders. He will cultivate the neighbors’ land and earn an additional income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед житель района Кубадиён. Ему 23 года. Он женат и живет с женой и маленькой дочерью у родителей. Умед собирается начать животноводческий бизнес. Животноводство в Таджикистане является экономически самой выгодной отраслью сельского хозяйства. Это обуславливается естественным условием Таджикистана, где 93% всей территории занимают горы и предгорные районы, имеющие хорошие пастбищные зоны. Кубадиён в числе таких предгорных район. Умед планирует заняться куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он будет каждый месяц закупать двух голов бычка, откармливать в течение месяца и затем продавать с наценкой. У него имеется сбережение в размере 800 TJS, а также коровник размером 5х3м. Чтобы закупить скот и его корм, он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Umed is 23 years old, married, and has a young daughter. He and his family live with his parents in the Qubadiyon district. Umed is getting ready to start a livestock business. This is the most profitable branch of agriculture in Tajikistan due its natural geography, as 93% of the land consists of mountains and foothills. Qubadiyon is located in the foothills, where there is good pasture land. Umed is planning to buy and sell cattle. Every month he will buy two calves, fatten them up over the course of a month, and then sell them at a profit. He already has a 5x3 meter cowshed and 800 TJS in savings. He has asked for a loan in order to purchase the cattle and feed.

loans.use: to buy two calves and feed

loans.name: Noupagagnon  E Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON E sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  46 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  NIOGO 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the NOUPAGAGNON E group are married women. They are of an average age of 46 years old with three children and all live in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).
They collaborate with the micro finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their agricultural activities during the wintering.
This is their seventh loan for agricultural activities from the institution and all the previous loans have been repaid correctly.
The crops that they cultivate are among other things, groundnuts, rice, corn, and chili as in the case of Niogo who is the first person on the left in the photo sitting down. With her loan she plans to buy products for the earth and pay labour costs for the upkeep of 1 hectare.
The crop is sold in the village after the harvest to a masculine and feminine clientele.
They hope to make an average profit of 175 000FCFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay labour costs and purchase products for the earth.

loans.name: Isauro

texts.es: El Sr. Isauro tiene 33 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Paso el Chivo,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Isauro va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de papa  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Isauro enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindad, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Isauro, 33, grows a variety of vegetables, including potatoes, yuca, and corn, on his land in the town of Paso el Chivo. This will be his first loan cycle with the institution. Isauro will use the loan to buy potato seed and supplies needed to prepare the land. He is requesting the loan so that he has funding for planting.

Isauro faces challenges such as inclement weather that many times destroys the plantings. He will use the income to improve his and his family's standard of living, as he is responsible for all the household expenses. He is responsible, hardworking, and grateful for the institution's support. Once the crop is harvested, he will sell the product directly to customers at the local market.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Juan Carlos con quien tiene un hijo, al que cuidan en la casa que compró hace 4 años. Milena se dedica a la venta de comidas, dulces y bebidas en el cafetín de uno de los mejores colegios de la zona. Afirma que desde entonces aprendió a cocinar cada día mejor; pues la exigencia de los alumnos, profesores y directora le ayudaron a que hoy en día obtenga mayor venta, pues tiene mucho talento en la cocina. “Gracias a mi buena sazón también ofrezco pensión: desayuno, almuerzo y cena a los profesores. Me quedo a trabajar desde las primeras horas del día hasta el anochecer”, afirma. Es así que ahora desea aumentar su mercadería pues necesita vender mucho más.Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Milena, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar , leche , entre otros.
texts.en:
Milena, 29, is a hardworking woman living with her husband, Juan Carlos, with whom she has a son they care for in a house she bought four years ago.  Milena works selling food, candy and beverages in a snack bar at one of the best schools in the zone.  She affirms that since then she’s learned how to cook better every day because demand from students, teachers and the principal helped her to increase sales to date because she’s a very talented cook.  “Thanks to the tasty way I cook I also offer daily meals, breakfast, lunch and dinner, for the teachers.  I stay at work from the early hours in the morning until nightfall,” she affirms.

She now wants to increase her merchandise because she needs to sell much more.  This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue forward. Milena will use the 1,000 soles to buy food items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a vender ropa interior su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus productos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poder seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client makes a living selling underwear and has her business located in her home. For several years, she has had a lot of customers, as she sells her products at a good price. With the profits she earns, she is able to afford some household expenses. She lives with her life partner and daughter in her own house. 

The client is asking for a loan to be able to buy wholesale merchandise to better supply her business, to earn better profits and be able to continue helping with household expenses without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Santa Catalina De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA CATALINA DE ESCOMA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanas de tejido de ponchos, venta de frutas, venta de salchipapas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanía (bordado de cuadros); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien trabaja en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento del capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene trece hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito
texts.en:
The “Santa Catalina de Escoma” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by María.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: knitting ponchos, fruit sales, ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] sales, food sales and neighborhood store.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like María.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having done so thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business making and selling crafts (cross stitch embroidery).  She makes it known that she learned this business form her mother who also works in this line of work.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric from street markets in El Alto and after fabrication will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home the best way possible since she’s married and has 13 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Tsira

texts.en:
Tsira is 36 years old. She lives in Khashuri district with her retired parents and 9-year-old son. Tsira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Tsira’s father is an artisan. He works for private orders on house construction and renovation to earn a small salary. Some additional family  income is provided by Tsira’s parents' monthly pensions. 

Tsira requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tsira has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Tsira will start selling household goods. She will buy at the wholesale price and resell with a price markup among the villagers. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income for the family. With the profit Tsira will purchase more household goods to have a better choice to offer her customers.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start selling household goods

loans.name: Vardo

texts.en:
Vardo is 63 years old and retired. She lives in Khashuri District with her son. Vardo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Vardo gets a monthly pension of 125 Gel. The family doesn’t have any other source of the income at the moment.

Vardo requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Vardo has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Vardo will purchase a milk cow. She will be milking the cow every day. She will produce cheese, yogurt and other dairy products to sell among the villagers and at the local market. This will give Vardo an opportunity to earn some income for the family and provide better living conditions. She plans to reinvest profit in the same field and try to expand her agriculture.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a 41-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has had been running a general store and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. 

He needs additional capital for the growth of his business since the demands of his clients are increasing day by day. Therefore, his wife, Ameena, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for his store. He will purchase a variety of products, including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, and oils, to keep up with the increased demands of his clients. 

Ameena and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase items for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  F Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON F sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  MAMOU 1ère personne à droite de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the NOUPAGAGNON F group are married women. They are of an average age of 40, with three children and all live in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their agricultural business during the wintering.
This is their seventh farming loan from the institution and all the previous loans have been repaid.
The crops cultivated are among others: groundnuts, rice, corn, and chili as in the case of Mamou who is the first person on the right of the photo sitting down. With her loan she plans to buy products for the land and pay the labour costs for exploiting 1 hectare.
She sells the production in the village to clients both men and women.
She hopes to make an average profit of 100 000FCFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and  help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay labour costs and purchase products for the land.

loans.name: Porteñitas De Lanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORTEÑITAS DE LANZA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de rellenos, panadería, costurera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien trabaja en este rubro, hace ocho años decide establecer su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento del capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Porteñitas de Lanza” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board presided over by Elena.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, soft-drink sales, turnover sales, bakery and seamstress services.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Elena.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for two cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from an institution promoter that visited her at home.  She currently has a food business.  She makes it known that she learned the business from her mother who also is in this line of work.  She decided to start her own business 8 years ago.
