The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy vegetables in the city of El Alto’s street markets and then sell the food in her sales space once she makes it.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home as best as possible since she’s single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: María Belén

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María Belén, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 7 años que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es electromecánico.

Doña María Belén con la finalidad de ganar sus propios recursos tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos para automóviles, en su local sus clientes pueden conseguir repuestos de todo tipo desde eléctricos hasta neumáticos, aceites, entre otras cosas, ella aprovecha para vender los repuestos a su esposo ya que él tiene un taller muy cerca donde realiza sus trabajos de electromecánica en los automóviles. Trabaja todos los días sola y lleva con su negocio 5 años el mismo que le deja muy buenas satisfacciones.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos para automóviles, los mismos que recibe en su local. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado tanto el banco como sus compañeras. 

Su sueño es tener el mejor local de repuestos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dulce Amistad meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte canton, an area known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by its warm, kind, hardworking residents. María Belén, 25, lives here. She is married and has two children, ages 9 and 7, who attend school. Her husband is an electrical mechanic.

To earn income, María Belén sells automobile spare parts from a store where her customers can find all kinds of parts from electrical items to tires, oil, and more. She also sells parts to her husband, who owns a nearby shop where his does electrical work on autos. She works alone every day. She has run her business for five years, and it has brought her great satisfaction.

This loan will be used to buy auto spare parts she needs in her store. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and loves the help that both she and her fellow members have received. She dreams of owning a larger spare parts store.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband owns a card printing shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently they are facing a serious load shedding problem (regular power outages) in the area. Because of that Mehnaz's husband is unable to fulfill the demands of customers on time and generate a good amount of income. He wants to purchase a generator for his business so that he can work easily. 

For that purpose his wife Mehnaz has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing a generator. This will help him to fulfill the demands of customers on time and to continue his work.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia, 38, lives in the small village of Bughaura, Surami district, with her 43-year-old husband, her retired parents-in-law and 18-year-old daughter. Lia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Lia’s husband is an artisan. He is working on house renovations for private orders to earn a small income for the family. Their additional income is Lia’s parents-in-law’s monthly pensions. 

Lia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Lia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Lia will renovate the house in order to rent it out. Surami district is a tourist area in summer. It’s popular for its beautiful nature and fresh air, so a lot of families go there for summer vacations. Lia will have the rooms to rent out and earn a good profit.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To renovate the house in order to rent it out

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a married woman with five children. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Lika

texts.en:
Lika is nineteen years old. She lives in Gori district with her 21-year-old husband, two-year-old son and mother-in-law. She has a business selling cosmetics to other villagers. Her husband is an artisan and works on private orders, while her mother-in-law is a kindergarten teacher. They all earn small monthly salaries.

Lika applied for a loan from several local financial institutions for a family business start-up but without success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of the family’s low income and poor living conditions.

Then Lika requested a 800 USD start-up loan from Credo. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

With her loan Lika will start selling clothes from Turkey. She will go there to buy clothes at wholesale, bring them back to her district and sell them at retail. She will reinvest part of her profits in the same field and purchase more stock.

This loan will give Lika an opportunity to earn additional income for the family. With it she will be able to provide a better life for her young son.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes from Turkey.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is currently attending Pedro Domingo Murillo, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. With the loan, Eliseo plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Eliseo hopes to be able to better understand his subjects.

To help afford his school and living expenses, Eliseo currently works 30 hours a week as a tailor. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Eliseo earns $8 a day. With a degree in business he expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Eliseo is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for textbooks

loans.name: Guido

texts.en:
To achieve his goal, Guido has enrolled in Pedro Domingo Murillo. He expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Guido shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

With the loan, Guido plans on using his loan to buy his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies he feels he will be able to get better grades. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, he expects to earn $9 a day. Unfortunately, Guido's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Guido is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Kiva Loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Guido currently works 25 hours a week.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for textbooks

loans.name: Esteban Martin

texts.en:
Esteban dreams of becoming a professional musician. To achieve his goal, Esteban has enrolled in Conservatorio Nacional De Musica. He plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation.

With the loan, Esteban plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Esteban feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. He expects to earn $10 a day - a substantial increase from before. With eight older siblings Esteban is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own. Esteban's father's salary from his job as a auditor is the family's primary source of income.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for textbooks

loans.name: Yorgina

texts.en:
Yorgina is currently attending the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi, working towards her degree in business. She expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Yorgina shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

With the loan, Yorgina plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Yorgina feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $14 a day, a substantial increase from before. Yorgina currently works 40 hours a week as a Cajera to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for textbooks

loans.name: Mariana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada  y no ha podido tener hijos propios pero tiene dos que crio como que si fueran de ella, ambos ya son mayores de edad  y la menor estudia en la universidad, ambos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Mariana es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante por sus propios medios, ella se dedica a al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  en este lugar  también vende electrodomésticos y productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y su hija le ayuda en su negocio cuando está desocupada. Tiene su negocio ya por más de 14 años, el mismo que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones. 

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y ciertos artículos de bazar. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que crezca más su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) communal bank meet in Rocafuerte Canton every fifteen days.  This place is known for the delicious sweets locals, who are known for being warm-hearted, kind and hardworking, make that are famous throughout the country.

Mariana, 65, lives here.  She’s married and was unable to have children of her own but has two that she raised as if they had been hers.  Both are adults now; the younger one attends university and both still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Mariana is a very hardworking woman who likes to get ahead by means of her own efforts.  She works in commerce.  She has a grocery store at home where she also sells home appliances and housewares.  She works every day from 7am until 8pm; her daughter helps her with the business when she’s not otherwise occupied.  She’s had her business for more than 14 years now and it has brought her much satisfaction.

This loan is to buy foodstuffs and housewares to stock her store.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her much.  Her dream is to continue working and that the business grows more.

loans.use: to buy groceries and housewares.

loans.name: Milton Geovanny

texts.es: Don Milton y su familia habitan en el barrio Hileah una zona con mucha pobreza y delincuencia, el tiene la edad de 31 años, trabaja como promotor, su esposa asistente de bodega ambos procrearon 2 hijos que ya tienen las edades de 5 y 7 añitos que van a la escuela, para don Milton la educación y el bienestar de ellos es prioridad. Esta es su segunda experiencia de crédito con Afodenic la cual solicita para mejorar parte del techo de su casa y construir un muro frontal para brindarles mejor protección a sus hijos que están pequeños.
texts.en: Milton and his family live in the Hileah neighborhood in an area suffering from a lot of poverty and delinquency. He is 31 years old and works as a promoter, his wife work as a grocery store assistant, together they had two children who are 5 and 7 years old and go to school. For Milton, his children's education and well-being is a priority. This is his second time of taking a loan from Afodenic, which is he seeking to improve part of the room of his home and build a wall in front of the premises to give his children better protection as they are small.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, zinc and steel sheets.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
This is Joan. Previously, she acquired a loan which helped her with her business, the family's expenditures and her children's education. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide for their everyday needs.

Joan is applying for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund which she uses to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her extra profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s educational expenses.

Joan dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients, of which Joan is one, are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy scrap and recyclable materials.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 41-year-old, married father of three children. Since 1996, he has been employed in a laboratory of dental equipment. His wife is unemployed which makes him the exclusive financial provider of the family. His three children are in private schools, which means that he has to pay the tuition fees on top of the family expenses for food and other necessities, while his income is barely enough to provide for all these expenses. 

Bassam contacted Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development in order to acquire a loan that would help him settle the debts of his children's  school tuition fees. This would be greatly beneficial because it would alleviate the burden of the expenses and would help him provide a better life for his family. 

As for his future career plans, Bassam wishes to expand the laboratory he works in.

loans.use: to settle the debts of his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda dreams of continuous growth in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child who is under age. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees

She has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating firewood into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase five sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.en:
Agueda dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Agueda is currently attending the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi, working towards her degree in business. She plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save money until she can return to school.

With the loan, Agueda plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Agueda feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling Agueda is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own. To help afford her school and living expenses, Agueda currently works 25 hours a week as a vendedora.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies

loans.name: Yeymi Graciela

texts.en:
Yeymi has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. She plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With the loan, Yeymi plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently, Yeymi earns $9 a day. With a degree in business she expects to earn $14 a day. With one younger brother, Yeymi hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university. To help afford her school and living expenses, Yeymi currently works 40 hours a week as a logistics coordinator.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Rocio Marcela

texts.en:
Rocio has always dreamt of becoming a professional. To achieve her goal, Rocio has enrolled in the Universidad Domingo Savio. She plans on graduating in December 2013 and without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation.

With the loan, Rocio plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Rocio hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university. To help afford her school and living expenses, Rocio currently works 40 hours a week as a accounting assistant.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años, el mayor estudia en la universidad y los menores en  colegio. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en el Municipio de Rocafuerte.

Doña María es  una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas diarias de preferencia en las mañanas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes.  Lleva más de 3 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) communal bank meet in Rocafuerte Canton every fifteen days.  This place is known for the delicious sweets locals, who are known for being warm-hearted, kind and hardworking, make that are famous throughout the country.

María, 38, lives here. She’s married and has three children who are 19, 17 and 14 years of age.  The oldest attends university and the other two attend secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver and works for the city of Rocafuerte.

María is a very good mother and housewife who in order to help her husband with family expenses works in commerce.  She sells products of the Avon brand via catalog (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works every day two to three hours per day preferably in the morning.  She sells on credit and collects weekly or biweekly according to customers’ wishes.  She’s been in business more than three years and is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help provided by the institution.  Her dream is to see her children finish their schooling and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es: Doña maria de 65 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, ella posee un negocio de elaboracion y venta de hamacas desde hace 25 años tienen mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, doña maria esta solictando un credito para la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando las hamacas como hilos de colores, lazos, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a asu familia lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: María is 65 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son.  She has had a business producing a selling hammocks for 25 years and has many customers as her products are of very good quality and available at accessible prices.  María is applying for a loan to buy materials, such as coloured threads and rope, in order to continue making hammocks and to be able to increase her profits and provide her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy coloured threads and rope.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
Mehboob is a forty-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She and her family live in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Mehboob runs a small embroidery business from her house. Her embroidered clothes are very popular. She uses a variety of materials including colorful thread, beads, stones and needles.

Presently Mehboob’s stock of materials is almost out, so she is applying for a 37,000 PKR loan through Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to put her extra profits toward the building of her family’s house.

Mehboob is hopeful that she will earn enough in profits so that she can both easily pay back her loan as well as help with construction. She is very happy with the loan because she feels this will help her realize her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf, who is 39 years old, is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in the home he owns, which he bought using income from his business. Asaf's business is connected to the beauty industry; he sells perfume, makeup and other beauty accessories. His shop is located at the local bazaar, which is called a trading center. He likes his work because it provides him with the financial income he uses to cover his children's needs. 
He knows that through his effort and dedication, he will manage to provide for his family. That is why he does not want his business to be weakened. 
Thanks to the loans he receives from Kiva partner VFAC, 11 years ago he started this business and he is grateful to all the people who help grant him the loan he needs in order to achieve his goals. On the other hand, he also promises to make his installment payments. He will use the amount requested to buy perfume and makeup items.

loans.use: To buy  perfume and makeup to sell

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita wants to buy a dairy cow with the loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting from Kiva lenders.

Merita lives in southeastern Albania. Livestock is the activity that she’s been in for about six years now, with her clientele growing the last couple of years. She is a 37-year-old married lady and has 11-year-old twins
. 
“Livestock is something that the majority of us in the villages enjoy doing. It’s not that it is easy, but we got no other choices anyhow. My husband helps me and I very much appreciate it.”  We secure our dairy and meat, and we sell to the local market in a little nearby town to generate an income, Merita went on to say.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 40-year-old, married housewife who is living with her husband and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2005, her husband has been running a shoe shop in the market, while Naheeda sells shoes at home, as well. 

Naheeda has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase a greater variety of shoes for the shop, so that they can increase their sales and net income. 

She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house since she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Santos Ruben

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Santos' dream. To achieve his goal, Santos has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. He plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation.

With the loan, Santos plans to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, he expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. Santos's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of 8, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Santos is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Santos currently works 30 hours a week as a independiente.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German dreams of becoming a professional. German is currently attending the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in May 2015, but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school.

With the loan, German plans on using his loan to buy his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a career in business, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. German's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of 6, finances have always been tight. With three other siblings German is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own. To help afford his school and living expenses, German currently works 40 hours a week as a sales rep and earns $13 a day.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un señor de 47 años de edad, casado,  11 hijos quienes  son  8 hombres y 3 mujeres todos ellos mayores de edad, 
Pedro  vive en  el Sector Senté, Cantón Chujulimul, municipio de Chichicastenango, departamento de Quiché.
El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica. El elabora la ropa en su casa de habitación a donde los interesados en comprarlo llegan, se prueban la ropa y luego la compran. El se dedica a esta actividad porque es una habilidad que ha adquirido con el pasar del tiempo y con lo cual sostiene a su familia porque le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir  la alimentación, vestimenta y otros gastos de la familia.
El necesita un apoyo financiero, por lo cual está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para compra de hilo para elaborar más ropa típica.
Sueña con tener varios locales o puntos de venta para brindarles su producto a más personas y con ello incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro, 47, is married and has 11 adult children, eight boys and three girls. Pedro lives in the Senté neighborhood of Chujulimul canton in Chichicastenango, Quiché. He makes and sells traditional clothing to interested customers, who come to his house to try on the garments and later buy them. This is his profession because he acquired the skills over time. This trade supports his family because it allows him to generate the income he needs to pay for food, clothing, and other household expenses.

He needs funding and has applied for a loan of Q 6,000.00 to buy thread to make traditional garments. He dreams of having several shops so that he can offer his merchandise to more people, thereby increasing his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional garments.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida hopes to have another tricycle. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  That is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle motorcycle.

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This able and dedicated staff has come to SMT and its Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 16,400,000 SLL to be shared among the entire team in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs. At the end of each month the group can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making salary deductions and loan payments on its behalf.

Samuel, 39, is the group’s leader. He has taught school for eight years now. A native of Kenema, he is married and has two children who are attending primary and secondary school. He will use his portion of the loan to buy building materials such as corrugated iron sheets, cement, etc. to construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct a house for his family.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Don Alejandro de 52 años de edad se dedica a al cultivo de maíz desde hace 30 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en las agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, don Alejandro esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Don Alejandro is 52 years old and he has been harvesting corn for 30 years. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in graneries, as shown in the photo so that later he can sell it to agencies that supply basic necessities in and around his home. He lives in his own home with his wife and three children. Don Alejandro is asking for this credit so he can purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides etc, so he can have better harvests and give his family a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Loeurn

texts.en:
Loeurn, aged 40, has a common-law relationship with her husband and together they have a child.  She learned to work in the agricultural business from her parents at a very early age. Until now she has been with that business for almost 25 years, making a net profit of KHR 5,000 per day.

The loan that she is requesting from HKL is to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to cultivate rice. In order to buy the agricultural supplies, she needs to reach her suppliers in a local market that is 7 km from her home. Using the loan, she hopes to obtain income to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Om-Laith Group

texts.en:
Om-Laith group consists of four ladies from Aden, Yemen. Each member has their own type of business. They have requested a group loan of YER 150,000 and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Sahar is 26 years old and a mother of one child. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. The income of her husband is not enough to cover living expenses and the rent of the house, so she decided to apply for a YER 30,000 loan from (AMB) to buy a refrigerator and an air-conditioner to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and air-conditioner to use in her house.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 40 years old. She has two children. The first one is a student and the second one is in the tenth grade. Her husband is a carpenter.  He earns about 10,000,000 VND. Lan works in the Commune Woman’s Union. Her salary is 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. 

Lan's challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to invest in her family’s carpentry workshop and lack of product output. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps that helps her get to this dream. She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain earnings and save profit for her children’s education. Lan is a hardworking woman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop

loans.name: Sirenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIRENAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lupe es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de sombreros, venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lupe es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de una amiga y está trabajando en el mismo hace quince meses.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra cosméticos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener sus estudios pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “SIRENAS” communal bank will start the first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of seven members and is managed by a board of directors where Lupe is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank perform are varied, including: selling hats, fruits, food, vegetables, clothes, cosmetics and weaving blankets.

The loan that they will obtain will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs among which Lupe is a member. She says that this is the first time that she is a member of Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a partner of the institution. She currently has a business selling cosmetics, it is worth knowing that she undertook this business on the recommendation of a friend, and has been working in it for fifteen months. 

The loan that she will take out now is for a capital increase (to buy cosmetics) which she will buy from distribution companies and she will then sell in her sales area. This manner of working will enable her to generate the resources to continue her studies as she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 47 years old and a hardworking woman. She has two children who are both carpenters. Her husband drives a truck to earn a living. His income is about 5,000,000 VND. For the past twenty years Tam has worked as a farmer. She not only raises pigs and chickens but makes wine to sell as well. She earns about 6,000,000 VND per month, meaning together her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month.

The challenges Tam faces are not only a lack of money but also the knowledge needed to raise healthy pigs and chickens. Her dream is for successful futures for her children, so if she receives this SEDA loan, it will be one step toward realizing her dream.

Tam has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In her last loan cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this new loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for her pigs and chickens. She will be able to make more money and save for her children’s futures.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine, a 53-year-old villager from the northeastern part of Albania, is pictured here with Nikolle, her spouse. They have four children ranging in age from their early teens to mid-twenties.

For almost ten years Martine has been raising cows. She sells dairy products in the local market of a nearby town of approximately 15,000 residents. She has made a respectable income from her dairy products, an amount that’s been okay, according to Martine and Nikolle.

The couple wants to buy another dairy cow with a calf, so Martine is applying for a 300,000 ALL loan through VisionFund Albania. Kindly note this is their fifth loan from the same institution, with the previous ones being successfully paid off. The couple aims to enlarge their dairy further in the upcoming years.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow with a calf

loans.name: Pashk

texts.en:
Pashk, a father of five children who lives in the rural north, is applying for a startup loan of ALL 100,000 (Albanian Lek) to stock up on inventory items for the little grocery store built in the neighborhood of a town where he resides. 

This will be his first loan, after his many attempts to request a loan and rejections he faced from almost all other financial institutions in the country, including VisionFund Albania. Kindly note that, according to the institution’s poverty rating tools, Pashk fell under the poverty level of regular clients.

Here is what Pashk said to the loan officer who interviewed him: “I am so grateful to Kiva for providing people in my financial situation with such an awesome opportunity. And very much, I wanted to thank all the kindhearted Kiva lenders.”

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his little neighborhood grocery store.

loans.name: Reina Noemy

texts.es: Doña reina de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende  las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; reina es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Doña reina tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Reina, 49, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two daughters. She owns a tortilla stand which is well known in the area in which she lives. She has many customers as she sells the best tortillas, warms and with a quick services and prices that are truly accessible. Reina is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead in life. She has a winning attitude which is why she always keeps ahead of the competition; she wants to run the risk of being able to grow her business which is why she is seeking a loan from Integral to buy corn in bulk. Reina is hopeful that in this manner she will bring financial security and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Maritza Emperatriz

texts.es: Maritza de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, maritza está solicitando un crédito para comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, ropa para niños, etc. y poder surtir su negocio con mas mercadería para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 41, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She has been selling clothes for several years.  Her business is located in her home.  With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to pay the household expenses.

Maritza is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, and children’s clothes, etc.  She wants to be able to stock her business with more merchandise in order to be able to give her family better financial security.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, and children’s clothes, etc.

loans.name: Ilda Marilu

texts.es:
Ilda es una joven de 26 años de edad casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y dependen de ella y de su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado y se dedica al cultivo de hortaliza como ser: papa, brócoli, coliflor, lechuga, repollo, etc. actividad inculcada por sus padres desde muy pequeña. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de los suegros de ella. El producto es comercializado en el mercado local y vendido a los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona.

Ilda solicita ayuda para la invertir en su cultivo de papa comprando fertilizantes y abono para fortalecer la planta y sus raíces y la tierra en la que esta plantado el producto.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar sus cosechas implementando un sistema de riego para mantener saludable y alimentado el producto como también los de seguir cultivando pero en cantidad y calidad para ofrecer más a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ilda is 26 years old, she is married and mother to two children who are youngsters and depend on her and her husband. She has a complete primary education up to sixth grade and she makes her living growing vegetables such as potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, lettuce and cabbage. This was an activity instilled in her by her parents from a young age. The land that Ilda and her husband work is their own thanks to an inheritance from her in-laws. The produce is sold in the local market and sold to the different intermediaries who come to the area.

Ilda is seeking help to invest in her potato crop, to buy fertilizers and manure to strengthen the plant, its roots and the land in which it is planted.

Her plans for the future are to be able to improve her crops, introducing an irrigation system to keep the product healthy and well fed, as well as to continue nurturing but in terms of quantity and quality to offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her potato crops.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther de 33 años de edad se dedica a la venta y elaboración de quesadillas desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela pues las vende a buen precio y es una persona muy amable, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, Esther esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar arroz, azúcar, quesillo, latas, etc. para poder seguir elaborando las quesadillas y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle  sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitaciones alguna.
texts.en:
Esther, 33 years old, has been making and selling quesadillas [a sweet dessert cake with cheese] for several years. She has many customers, since she sells them at a good price and is a very friendly person. She lives with her two children in her own house. 

Esther is requesting a loan to be able to buy rice, sugar, cheese, tins, etc., to be able to continue making quesadillas and to make more profits in order to give her children what they need without any limits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cheese, tins, etc.

loans.name: Claudia  Milagro

texts.es: Doña Claudia vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina natural su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tienen varios años de tenerlo y tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, doña Claudia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar medicina por mayor para poder surtir su negocio y poder atender mejor a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  She sells natural medicine.  Her business is located at the market that is close to where she lives.  She has had the business for several years, and she has a lot of clientele.  Her products are very good quality, and they are very affordable.

Claudia is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy medicine wholesale.  She wants to do this in order to be able to stock her business and to be able to better tend to her customers.  This way she will have improved earnings in order to give her family better financial security.

loans.use: to buy medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy is 51 years old. She has two sons. The first one is married and the second one is a carpenter. Her husband is a building worker and makes 4,500,000 VND per month. 

To earn a living, Vy is a carpenter. She has done this job for five years. Besides, she is also a farmer. She earns 3,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to invest in her carpentry workshop.

Her dream is that her children can grow up well and be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps to help her get to this dream. She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain earnings and save the profit for her children’s education. Vy is a hardworking woman.

Vy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for raising pigs and chickens and to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to expand her business and save money for her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy food for raising pigs and chickens and to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby and even at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and also competition from fellow clothes sellers.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children who go to school. Her husband is a businessman and, together, they own a house that has electricity, but no piped water. 

Halima has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. Apart from that, she sells charcoal and lesos (women's wrap clothes) to earn a living. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support, to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de jugos y licuados en su lugar de residencia, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su casa, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de otra licuadora y comprar los ingredientes para preparar sus alimentos como: naranjas, leche, fresas, chocolates, guineos, azúcar, etc. para seguir con su negocio pues esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: This client works selling fruit juice and smoothies from her home. She lives with her parents and siblings. She uses the income she earns from her work to contribute towards her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase another blender and ingredients to make her drinks, such as oranges, milk, strawberries, chocolate, bananas, sugar, etc. in order to keep her business going, since this is her only source of work and she wants to continue helping out with expenses at home.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, milk, strawberries, chocolate, bananas, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 39-year-old hardworking woman. Her husband is a laborer by profession, and he has a very low monthly income. She has five children who are currently studying in government schools. 

Nosheen has some enterprising skills, and she has been running a small business in her house. She has been selling crockery and utensils for households for five years. Her business is increasing with the passage of time. 

Currently, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would purchase new crockery items and utensils like plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc. so that her sales would be increased. 

With the profit amount, Nosheen would pay the tuition fees for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and is very hopeful for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase crockery items and utensils for selling purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares desde hace 7 años lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que estan cerca de su vivienda, el cliente vive con su familia en casa propia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son muy buenos y a precios accesibles con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas accesorios para surtir su negocio como: cargadores, carcasas, audífonos, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguir ayudando a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
This client works selling cell phone accessories. He has been doing this for seven years. He works as a street vendor in the different neighborhoods that are near his home. He owns the home where he lives with his family. He has a large customer base because his products are very good and his prices are affordable. The profit he makes allows him to cover his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more accessories to stock his business, such as chargers, cases, earphones, etc. so that he can keep working, obtain higher earnings, and continue helping his family with expenses at home.

loans.use: to purchase chargers, cases, earphones, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a new member of PMPC. She is 48 years old and married with two children. Evelyn is from Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. 

She buys and sells charcoal to earn a living. The business is doing well, with PHP 5,000 earned each month for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for retail. She wants to earn more from it. 

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and wants to save for her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell/retail.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: Don oscar de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica  a la venta de zapatos y sandalias desde hace varios su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Oscar esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas zapatos y sandalias por mayor para poder surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Oscar, 47, lives in his own house with his family.  He has worked selling shoes and sandals for several years.  His business is located in a market near his place of residence.  With profits earned he’s able to cover some of his household expenses.  Oscar is asking for a loan to be able to buy more shoes and sandals at wholesale to stock his business and earn higher profits that will help him have better economic stability with his family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and sandals at wholesale.

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Susana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, doña susana esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su familia podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Susana, 45, lives in her own house with her life companion and their son.  She has a sewing workshop at home where she makes various types of clothes.  Lately her clientele has increased because she does excellent work at really affordable prices.  She’s a woman who is very dedicated to her work; she’s responsible and honest.  Susana’s asking for this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, needles and everything related to sewing so she can continue meeting customer demand and she and her family will be able to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica, vive en casa de un familiar con su compañera de vida y su hija. El trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés y pan dulce tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus alimentos a buen precio y es muy limpio a la hora de elaborar el pan,  el cliente esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para el  puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This client is a very responsible person who is always looking for ways to improve his economic stability.  He lives in a family member’s house with his life companion and their daughter.  He works in his own bakery making French bread and sweet bread.  He has a large clientele because he sells his food at a good price and he’s very clean while making the bread.  He’s asking Integral for a loan in order to have the help needed to buy flour, yeast, shortening, baking pans and everything necessary to produce more.  This project of improving his bakery is very important to him because it will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Tamare Elise Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elise est une femme âgé de 37 ans, fiancée mère de 2 enfants de 8 et 13 ans. Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 1 an déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des savons,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Elise is 37 years old, engaged  and has 2 children who are 8 and 13. She has owned and managed a food shop in a neighborhood of the capital city for one year. Her small business is successful thanks to her warm personality, her experience in the business and her loyal customers. This last point is very important yet she struggles to satisfy her customers needs because she only has sufficient capital to buy her inventory at retail prices. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her business' capital, to be able to diversify her inventory (rice, salt, bottled water, sugar, soaps), and to be able to increase her profit margins. She plans to reinvest a portion of her profits back into the business to cover expenses and the other part she will use to take care of her and her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of essential food items.

loans.name: Istat

texts.ru: Истату 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Двоих сыновей и одну дочь. Истат с юных лет старалась найти источник дохода и обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она более 21 лет занимается купле продажей сухофруктов и риса. Истат привозит товар с Киргизии. Она продает товар оптом. Истат ведет бизнес успешно и честно. Она хочет развевать бизнес и увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки абрикоса для обработки и изготовления сухофрукты. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Istat is 48 years old, married and has three children: two sons and one daughter.  Since she was young, Istat has tried to find a source of income to provide her family with all life's necessities.  For more than 21 years, she has sold dried fruits and rice.  Istat brings her goods in from Kyrgyzstan and and then sells them.  Istat runs her business successfully and honestly.  Now, she wants to expand and increase her income.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy apricots to process.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy apricots for processing

loans.name: Violetas-31 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento  las VIOLETAS-31 está compuesto por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, el presidente del banco es el Sr. Rene tiene 66 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 20 años, el se dedica al servicio de transporte público, el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, el Sr. Rene utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital para el arreglo de su movilidad ya que está presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, el Sr. Rene se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a él ya que trabaja años con la institución y le ayudo a crecer en su actividad, y también se siente agradecido por el apoyo a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias
texts.en:
The “Violetas-31” (Violets-31) communal bank has nine members: seven women and two men.  The bank’s president is René, 66.  He has a 20-year-old son.  He works providing public transportation services.  He’s been in this line of work for several years now.  René will use this loan to repair his vehicle.  His reason for requesting this loan is the lack of capital to repair his vehicle that’s having some mechanical problems that keep him from doing good work.

René feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided him since he’s been working with the institution for years and it helped his business to grow.  He also feels grateful for the support from his fellow group members because often they are people who are their family’s sole source of support.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es una persona de 60 años de edad, tiene 12 hijos, él y su familia viven en el Caserío Xolbé, Cantón El Tablón, Sololá
El es agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de  papa; a  través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva más de 25 años realizando esta labor junto a la mayoría de sus hijos quienes lo apoyan en todo el trabajo que requieren este cultivo.
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico para la siembra y el mantenimiento de papa.
Su sueño más importante es comprar más terreno y  sembrar mas  papa y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonio, 60, has 12 children.  He and his family live in Xolbé Hamlet, El Tablón Canton, Sololá.  He’s a potato farmer.  By means of this activity he earns acceptable income that helps him support his family.  He’s been in this line of work for more than 25 years and works alongside most of his children who help him with all the chores this crop requires.

He’s asking for a 10,000 Quetzal loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to provide maintenance for his potato crop.  His most important dream is to buy more and to plant more potatoes to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Tham's Group

texts.en:
Tham is 48 years old. She has one child. He is a soldier. Her husband is a carpenter and earns about 10,000,000 VND. 

Tham collects iron scraps to sell and works as a farmer to earn a living. She has done this job for ten years. She gains 5,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to invest in her business. She wishes she will have a full life with a modern house in the future. This loan helps her get to this dream. She can invest in her recycle workshop to gain earnings. Tham is a hardworking woman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her family’s carpentry workshop and for collecting more iron scraps to sell. She always wants to expand her business and save money for her family’s future.

Other members who are part of Tham's group include the following: 

Thung is 58 years old. She has three children. She is a Women’s Union officer. She wants to borrow 6,720,000 VND to do carpentry. 

Thanh is 51 years old. She has two children. She sells fruits. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more fruits.

loans.use: to buy wood for her family’s carpentry workshop and to collect more iron scraps to sell.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 3 курса. Мунира учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете Политики и Бизнеса. Мунира учится по специальности Финансы и кредит. Она учится отлично. Наравне с отличной учебой, она активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора, так как ее родители не имеют денег для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munira is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is 20 years old and not yet married.  She lives with her parents and is currently a third-year university student.  Munira studies at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business.  She's majoring in Finance and Credit.  She receives the highest marks.  On par with her studies, Munira takes part in the social life the school offers.  She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition since her parents are unable to do so.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Ermis Aracely

texts.es: Doña ermis de 44 años de edad se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Doña ermis es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ermis is 44 years old and works as a dressmaker and seller. She works from home. Ermis is an incredible woman and a great example because she is very hard-working, responsible, and positive. What’s more, many people give her good personal and work references. She makes all kinds of clothing at affordable prices. Her work is also of good quality, which is why many people like it. She has been working in this trade for many years and has built up a lot of experience; she now has many regular customers who prefer her work over others. She has decided on a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business by buying necessary supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic, etc., to make different items of clothing. She is doing this to be able to offer a better service to her customers, so that they keep coming to her, and so that her sales and income keep increasing. She hopes to achieve her goals and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Don Herminio de 50 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años también trabaja como jornalero en una finca que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, don Herminio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas y poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con sus cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Herminio, 50, has worked growing corn for several years and also works as a day laborer on a large agricultural estate near his place of residence.  With profits obtained from his sales he’s able to cover the expenses that come up at home.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  

Herminio’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, manure, seeds and herbicide and to be able to improve the land where he grows which is shown in the photograph so that he can continue planting and giving his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 38 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años su principal siembra es el maíz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en las agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos, con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar,  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, etc.ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprar lo necesario para su siembra y poder seguir con su trabajo para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, 38, has worked in agriculture for the last 13 years; his main crop is corn.  When he harvests it it’s ready to be sold to agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  With profits obtained from his sales he’s able to cover household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and son.

Jorge’s asking for a loan to be able to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, seeds, etc. because what he earns is insufficient to be able to buy everything needed for his crops so he can continue working and giving his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Doña marta de 52 años de edad es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que doña marta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Marta, 52, is very well-known in the zone where she resides because of her humility and dedication to work.  She’s never let herself been defeated and has always overcome her difficulties.  With effort and dedication she owns a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, milk, eggs and rice, among others.  She’s very dedicated to her work and very service oriented at the moment of selling which is why she has customers that seek her out and prefer her for her products.

She needs to stock the store a little better because of increased demand but does not have capital to do so which is why Marta is asking for a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages, etc.  She trusts in God that her only concern will be to provide daily sustenance for her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 44 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Doña reina solicta un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 44, works selling tortillas at home; she’s been doing this Monday to Sunday for years.  She has a large clientele because she’s a very hardworking, kind person.  With profits earned she’s able to cover her household expenses.  She lives in her own house with his husband and children.

Reina’s asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal to continue making tortillas thus earning higher profits to have better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Managua desde hace 30 años, tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. El se dedica a vender ropa y es dueña de una pulpería , negocio que inicio su madre  pero hace tres años es el señor Pilar quien lo administra, parte de sus actividades diarias consiste en salir a vender ropa en las afueras de Managua ,tiene buena clientela en Chontales un departamento ubicado en la zona norte su hijo menor la ayuda a vender . Su propósito es ir surtiendo más su pulpería la cual necesita de más productos. Es por tal motivo que necesita comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, aceite, snacks, productos de limpieza, galletas, pan etc.  Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y poner la pulpería en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Pilar, a 58-year-old man, has lived in the city of Managua for 30 years and has 5 grown children. He sells clothing for a living and is also the owner of a grocery store, a business that his mother started but that he has been running for the past 3 years. Part of his daily activities consists of selling clothing on the outskirts of Managua. He has good customers in Chontales, a section located in the northern zone. His youngest son helps him to sell. 

His goal is to invest more in the grocery store, which needs more products. For this reason, he needs to buy staple grains, sodas, oil, snacks, cleaning products, cookies, bread, etc. His next goal is to improve the infrastructure of his home and get the grocery store in better condition.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sodas, oil, snacks, cleaning products, cookies, bread, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Don Roberto de 38 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a las agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, don Roberto esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Roberto, 38, has worked growing corn for many years.  When he harvests it it’s ready to be stored in sacks like the ones shown in the photo to then go out to sell it to agencies near his place of residence that buy and sell grains.  With profits earned from his sales he’s able to cover household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 11 and 7 years of age and attending school at present.
