In the picture above are a group of primary school teachers located in Waterloo, a town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers is applying for a loan of SLL 11,400,000 from Kiva’s field partner, SMT. School staff and other salaried workers normally come to SMT to apply for loans. 

With these loans, they are empowered to meet certain financial challenges that they cannot meet, left alone with their salaries. However, with the help of SMT/Kiva lenders' loans, some of these borrowers will be able to pay school fees for their children, invest in businesses, buy housebuilding materials or pieces of furniture, etc. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar directly deducts their total repayment amounts owed and repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

The featured leader of this team is Samuel. Thirty-eight-year-old Samuel is a native of Kalangba village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is a husband to a businesswoman and a father of 6 children, 4 of whom are attending primary school and the others are still not of school-going age. Samuel is a professional school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for himself. Samuel is pursuing further studies in college.

(These teachers came to the office in two separate batches to collect the loan, hence two different photos attached together.)

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself. Samuel is pursuing further studies in college.

loans.name: Alice C.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of able and dedicated teachers from Benguma in western Sierra Leone, near the capital city of Freetown. They are applying for a loan of SLL 10,500,000 in order to meet their most urgent financial challenges. At the end of each month they can repay the loan, using their salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Alice is the featured leader of this group. A native of Waterloo town, the 51-year-old has 2 children – 1 of whom is still in college and the other is no longer in school.  Alice has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. She has requesed this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.  

(These teachers came to the office in two separate batches to collect the loan, hence two different photos attached together)

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child.

loans.name: Kalamereh Ii Group

texts.en:
Adikalie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adikalie was born 40 years ago in Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary schools. 

For many years now, Adikalie has been selling bags – school bags, travelers’ bags, etc. He has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a 62-year-old man. He is married with three children, and he lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He has owned and managed a computer shop for three years, earning 10,000 PHP a month for a living. In order to purchase supplies and accessories, he borrowed 20,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he joined last year. Edgar wants to expand his business and save a portion of his profits for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and accessories.

loans.name: Tojiboy

texts.ru: Тожибой добродушный мужчина в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет одну дочку. Тожибой вместе с женой и дочерью живет в сельской  местности. И для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание, он занимается собственным бизнесом. Тожибой имеет большой опыт в сфере откармливания рогатого скота, а также в сфере выращивания сельхоз культуры. Основной доход он получает от откармливания и продажи скота. Жена помогает ему в этом деле. Днем она работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а вечером и утром ухаживает за скотом и доит коров. Каждый день коровы дают по 10 литров молока, затем жена продает это молоко местному населению. А Тожибой, параллельно с животноводством, выращивает сельхоз культуру, и потом он также продаёт полученный урожай. Для выращивания сельхоз культуры Тожибой имеет земельный участок площадью 2 га. Это дело приносит ему хороший дополнительный заработок. Сейчас Тожибой хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота для получения большей прибыли. Его дочь в данный момент заканчивает школу и будет поступать в Университет, поэтому Тожибою необходимы денежные средства для оплаты её образования. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит и на эти деньги закупить больше голов скота для дальнейшей продажи. Тожибой заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Tojiboy is a kindhearted fellow of 44. He is married and has one daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter out in the countryside. He earns a living running his own business. He is very experienced in raising cattle and farming. Most of his income comes from raising and selling livestock. His wife helps him with the business; in the afternoon, she works at a community farm, and in the evening and morning she looks after the animals and milks the cows. Each cow produces 10 liters of milk a day, and his wife sells it to people who live nearby. Along with raising animals, Tojiboy grows crops on a two-square hectare plot of land, and sells the harvest. This business brings him additional income. Now Tojiboy wants to increase his cattle herd to earn a large profit. His daughter is graduating from school and is going to enter the university, so Tojiboy needs money to pay for her education. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle so he can resell them later on. Tojiboy thanks Arvand for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chicken broaster and a small oven

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina vive en casa propia con sus hijos pero como la casa es grande ellos viven independientes, percibe una renta de jubilada, con la cual se mantiene, además para mejorar sus ingresos puso una tienda de barrio en su domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, poder surtir su mercadería y de esta manera no perder a sus clientes y además mejorar sus ingresos. La anterior vez que solicitó un préstamo de Kiva, éste le sirvió mucho pues pudo mejorar su stock. Ahora desea hacer lo mismo pues su mercadería ya se vendió y necesita comprar más para surtir la tienda. Necesita comprar más arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros.

El sueño de Rina se cumplio ya que era tener su casita y dar comodidad  a sus hijos, ahora está contenta con lo que hizo.
texts.en:
Rina lives in her own home with her children, but as it's a large house, they live independently. She receives a pension, with which she supports herself, and to boost her earnings she set up a neighborhood store in her home.

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital, stock her store and in doing so avoid losing customers and increase her income. The last time she requested a loan from Kiva, it helped her a great deal as she was able to improve her stock. She now wants to do the same again since her merchandize has already been sold and she needs to buy more items to stock the store. She needs to buy rice, sugar, pasta and other goods.

Rina achieved her dream, which was to own a home and make her children comfortable, and now she is content with what she has done.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey is married with 3 children. He is 31 years old and lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Jeffrey sells grocery goods and agrivet supplies for hogs to earn a living, and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 30,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase groceries and agrivet supplies for hogs. Jeffrey became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, he hopes to use his profits to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has six children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and cares for pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

She has requested a loan amount of PHP 14,900 to invest in her piggery business. Alma has been a member of PMPC for one year. She hopes to improve her living conditions in the future by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a widow with seven children. She is 62 years old and lives in Kinuman, Ozamis City. 

To earn a living, Felina plants and harvests corn and bananas for sale. She's been in this business for 30 years, earning 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. Now, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 60 years old and married with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban. For 18 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living.  

Anatalia been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and is now requesting a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to purchase additional inventory. In the future, she wants to improve her business and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Remedios is a farmer, raising watermelons, which she has been doing for five years. 

Remedios is requesting a loan from PMPC for 10,500 PHP, which she will use to buy watermelon seedlings and fertilizer for agricultural production. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her family's living conditions by using the income of her agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en:
After obtaining satisfactory results in the previous loan period, the Marga Indah Ternak group continues borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed and repair cages.

Ni Komang will use the loan to buy feed and repair cages. Ni Komang has six piglets for fattening and they are scheduled to be sold in five months. Ni Komang and her husband also plan to raise cattle. With the profits she earned last period, she bought a calf. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better, and if all goes well, she will increase the number of cows to be maintained.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed and repair cages.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is married with four sons and daughters. Ermelinda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ermelinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer for the farm production. 

Ermelinda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ermelinda hopes to improve her living conditions by using the income of the farm's corn production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm production.

loans.name: Buyankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Buyankhuu, 42 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their old house on a plot of land. She and her husband have been making interior decoration to entities on contract for about 10 years and have accumulated a vast amount of experience. This year, due to the presidential election, the interior decoration orders are minimal, so they decided to renovate their old house using this spare time. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, they will repair and insulate their old house. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to reduce their coal consumption and release less pollutants, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to repair and insulate her old house.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда женщина 48 лет. Мавлуда замужем и мать 4 детей. Муж Мавлуды находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Мавлуда очень заботливая, добрая, чистоплотная женщина. Она помогает своему мужу в содержании семьи. Мавлуда изгатавливает домашние колбасы по рецемтам своей бабушки, которая учила Мавлюду в детстве и продаёт в центральном рынке района.Также Мавлуда изгатавливает колбасы на заказ. Хотя этот вид торговли не прибыльная, но для содержании семьи хватает и она на это не жалуется. Несмотря на низкий доход Мавлуда с мужем уже выдали дочерей замуж. Мавлуда является молодой бабушкой, которая няньчит и балует своих внуков. Сын Мавлуды учится в ВУЗ-е и ей необходимо  купить компьютер для сына чтобы он мог пользоваться в своей учёбе, а также оплатить  учебу сына. Но у неё недостаточно средств,  несмотря на те средства которые отправляет ей муж. И поэтому поводу Мавлуда обратилась за кредитом в организацию Арванд. Она надеется на поддержку и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Mavluda is 48 and the mother of four. Her husband is working in Russia. Mavluda is a very thoughtful, kind, and decent woman. She helps her husband to support the family. She makes homemade sausage using a recipe her grandmother taught her when she was young, and sells it at the district's main market. She also makes custom-ordered sausage. Even though this business is not very profitable, it is enough for her family and she has no complaints about it. Despite their small income, Mavluda and her husband have already married off their daughter. Mavluda is a young grandmother who babysits and spoils her grandchildren. Her son is studying at college and she needs to buy a computer for him. She also has to pay for his tuition. But she cannot afford it, despite the money that her husband sends to her. So Mavluda has requested a loan from Arvand. She is counting on their support and expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay for  tuition

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Balide, Aurora, Zamboang del Sur. To make a living, Editha operates a general store, earning 8,000 a month. 

Editha is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional working inventory.  She joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services.  She plans to expand her business in order to assure the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional working inventory

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es comerciante, vende artículos de cotillón, vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación en un acabado de adobe y piso de cemento en la zona de Alto San Pedro  de la ciudad de la Paz.
Arturo vende sus productos para cubrir sus gastos de agua, luz, transporte y otros.
El credito lo  requiere para el aumento de su capital; comprará cartulina, pegamento, para elaborar el cotillón  y así mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Arturo es tener un local propio donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Arturo is a salesman who sells party favors.  He lives in his own home, occupying one room with adobe walls and a cement floor.  His house is located in Alto San Pedro, in the city of La Paz.

Arturo sells his products so that he can cover his water, electricity, transportation and other expenses.

Arturo's dream is to own his own premises from which to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy card and glue to make the party favors he sells

loans.name: Alfredo Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo, tiene 34 años vive con su pareja con la que tienen  un hijo de la edad de 5 años el Sr. Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura,  hace más de 11 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de Forestal Playon  Distante a 60 km. del Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de yuca  y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Alfredo is 34 years old and lives with his partner with whom he has a five-year-old child. Alfredo has worked in agriculture for over 11 years. They live in the community of Forestal Playon Distante, 60 km from Torno, where they have a plot of land on which they grow watermelon, corn, citrus fruits and manioc. The loan he has requested is to plant manioc and to cover the costs involved in preparing the ground. Everything that they grow they sell directly from the producer to the consumer in the local market. Alfredo feels happy and grateful with the organization for the support it provides, since this is the only activity that enables him to support his family.

loans.use: to plant manioc and prepare the ground.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish bathroom repairs in his shop, purchase a sign, and purchase additional inventory for the store.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна порядочная и добрая женщина. Она образованная женщина и хранительница очага своего дома. Мавзуна замужем за прекрасного человека, который работает кассиром в Микрозаемной организации. Мавзуна на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мавзуна хочет, чтобы ее дети получили хорошую образованию и стали высококвалифицированными людьми. Дети Мавзуны Мафтуна, Хабибулло и Хадиятулло учатся в лицее. Они успешно учатся и активно участвуют в общественной жизни школы. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы детей в лицее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a respectable and kind woman. She is well-educated and keeper of the hearth of her home. She is married to a wonderful husband who works as a cashier in a microlending institution, and has three children. Mavzuna wants to see her children get a good education and become highly skilled adults. Her children — Maftuna, Habibullo, and Hadiyatullo — go to a boarding school. They are good students and actively participate in the school's social life. Mavzuna is requesting a loan to pay for her children's tuition. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana,  se le presenta la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar las ganancias, ya que logro obtener una buena cosecha; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Juana needs more working capital to continue investing in her crops.  She is requesting a new loan which will allow her to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.

Juana's previous loan helped her to increase her profits as she enjoyed a good harvest.  Her financial situation and her family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Calacoto de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día como administrador en una empresa privada ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción del departamento donde actualmente vive ya que tiene mucha humedad y eso le afecta en su salud.
El sueño de Felix es mejorar sus ingresos para tener su casa propia y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida para tener mas comodidad y seguridad para su hijo.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Felix is single and has a school-aged child. He lives in  a rented house in just two rooms. The house is located in the area of Calacoto in the city of La Paz. He currently works for over eight hours a day as a director of a private company, since with his earnings he has to cover food and education expenses, rental and basic service fees.

He requires the loan to refurbish the apartment in which he is living at the moment, since it is very damp and that affects his health. Felix's dream is to boost his income so that he can have his own home and in this way improve his quality of life so things are more comfortable and safe for his child.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to refurbish the apartment in which he lives, since it is very damp.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en: Jeremias is from La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 34 years old. Jeremias used his last loan to purchase additional used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan in the amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more used shoes to sell. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Sri Cendana group now has 9 members and a new head, Ni Ketut. With a loan of 10 million Rupiahs (IDR), they will buy piglets and feed. Ni Ketut lives with her husband who works as a farmer. She has 2 children and they are married.

She used the loans to buy 2 superior quality piglets and feed. The pigs will be kept for 6 months for fattening. To keep down costs in feed, she is feeding it a mixture between traditional feed and artificial feed mill that does not reduce the quality of feed. Ni Ketut expects growth in the pig will be good and that she will sell them at a high price. She has a dream to renovate her house from the profit of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy 2 superior quality piglets and buy feed

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 29 years old. She has two sons who are in primary school. Her husband and she are carpenters. He earns about 10,000,000 Dong (VND) and Loan earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family's total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to run her carpentry workshop and lacking the knowledge to raise her children well. Her dream is her children can grow up well and have good jobs in the future. This loan is one of steps helps her reaching to this dream. She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain earnings. Loan is a hardworking woman and has a passion for business.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan, she borrowed 8,282,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more wood for her business. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en una empresa privada como ingeniero civil, por más de diez horas al dia ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material construcción (cemento, ladrillos, fierro, arena) ya que actualmente  realiza la construcción de un  departamento en la casa de sus padres, ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Jose Luis, es mejorar sus ingresos para terminar con la construcción de su vivienda para tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his parents' house in Chijini, in the city of La Paz.

Jose Luis currently works for a private company as a civil engineer.  He works more than ten hours a day as he needs to cover the cost of his food and basic services.  He needs this loan to buy building supplies (cement, bricks, iron and sand).  He is currently building an apartment within his parents' home as he would like to improve his quality of life.

Jose Luis' dream is to improve his income so that he can finish building his home and live more comfortably.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to continue building an apartment in his parents' house

loans.name: Jagadamba Group

texts.en:
Sujeshta is 45 years old and lives in Tetelkhunti village of Balangir district, Odisha, India. The lady standing second from right with raised hand in the photograph is Sujeshta. She lives with her husband and three sons of twenty-six, twenty and thirteen years of age. She belongs to a poor family. 

Sujeshta has been running an ice cream making and vending business with salt, biscuits and detergent powder retailing for the last 15 years. Her husband and two sons manage the business. Her husband goes to a wholesale market 300 kms away once a month to bring the stock of salt, detergent powder and ingredients for ice-cream. 

From the above business Sujeshta earns approximately 7000 INR which is not sufficient for her to manage her household expenses along with investment for her business. To expand her business Sujeshta formed a group named Jagadamba, taking in other five women from her village to take loans from Mahashakti Foundation. From the present loan she has planned to purchase raw ingredients for her ice-cream business and bulk amounts of salt, biscuits and detergent for resale. She hopes this will help her to increase her income for materializing her dreams of construction of a house and marriage of her sons.

The other borrowers of the group are Tilottama, Nalini, Hemalata, Saebani and Tapaswini with a general store, puffed rice, procurement of pulses (lentils, etc.) and puffed rice selling businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing raw ingredients for her ice-cream business and bulk amounts of salt, biscuits and detergent

loans.name: Bublen Group

texts.en:
Tapaswini, aged 40 years, is a very active lady from a rural village called Tetelkhunti of Balangir district in Odisha, India. Tetelkhunti village is remotely located and out of reach of basic facilities. Tapaswini leaves with her husband and one son of seventeen years. Tapaswini has been running a bicycle repair business for the last twenty years with the help of her husband. Her husband also sells bicycle spare parts to his clients at reasonable rates. He has very good technical skills in his occupation and his customers from 10 or12 nearby villages trust him very much. He brings cycle spare parts thrice in a month from the nearby town Titilagarh, which is 15 kms. away from the village. 

From the present business Tapaswini earns 200 INR per day, which is hand to mouth for her. Due to this situation, till now she has not been able to construct a good house for her family.  So these poor circumstances compel Tapaswini to search for a credit source for the expansion of her business. To fulfill her dream, In the year 2013 Tapaswini, along with other four poor women from her village, formed a Joint Liability Group named Bublen. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Mahashakti Foundation for further expansion of her husband’s business. She will use the loan to buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities, which will help her provide better services to her clients and increase her profits. Tapaswini hopes to build a permanent cycle repairing cabin in her village.

The other four members of the group are Sunanda, Saraswati & Basanti with puffed rice businesses  and Rebati with a tailoring center.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bicycle repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and has two children. She lives in Laperian, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Maria owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of used shoes to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She hopes to improve her business to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings in her shoe stall.
